meanings.sent1: The rabbit decamps when it hears a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She decamps from the party as soon as she gets a phone call.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decamps from the tree when it sees a playful dog approaching.
meanings.sent4: The students decamp from the classroom like a flock of birds dispersing.
meanings.sent5: The thief decamps from the scene of the crime before anyone notices.

meanings.definition: To leave a place in a hurry
meanings.sent1: The cat decamps from the room when it hears the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent2: He decamps from the meeting to catch his train.
meanings.sent3: The children decamp from the playground when it starts to rain.
meanings.sent4: The birds decamp from the tree as the storm approaches.
meanings.sent5: The explorer decamps from the jungle as night falls.
